summary: Our culture's default assumption is that everybody should always be striving for perfection -- settling for anything less is seen as a regrettable compromise.  This is wrong in most software development situations: focus instead on keeping the software simple, just "good enough", launch it early, and iteratively improve, enhance, and re-factor it.  This is how software success is achieved!
title: "Good enough" is good enough!
